docstrings:
"""
    Adds a message to inform the user about Withings integration if their
    account is not already integrated with Withings.

    :param msg: The message text to use if the user is not integrated. If msg
        is a callable, it is called with the request as the only parameter.
        Otherwise, msg is passed in as the message text. If no message is
        provided, the value in :ref:`WITHINGS_DECORATOR_MESSAGE` is used.

    This decorator does not prevent the user from seeing the view if they are
    not integrated with Withings - it only adds a message to the user's
    messages. If you would like to change the behavior of your view based on
    whether the user is integrated, you can check the user's status by using
    :py:func:`withingsapp.utils.is_integrated`.

    Example::

        from django.http import HttpResponse
        from django.contrib.auth.decorators import login_required
        from withingsapp.decorators import withings_integration_warning

        @withings_integration_warning(msg="Integrate your account with Withings!")
        @login_required
        def my_view(request):
            return HttpResponse('Visible to authenticated users regardless'
                                'of Withings integration status')

    In this example, the ``withings_integration_warning`` decorator only
    operates if the user is logged in. The view content is visible to all
    users who are logged in, regardless of Withings integration status.

    The template(s) for any view with this decorator should display a user's
    messages.
    """
